definition: will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: Less trust and more cantankerousness might not necessarily be a bad thing, however, Hamann and his group wrote.
sentences.chinese: 然而，将信将疑，爱唱反调也并不一定是件坏事。

sentences.english: Hood was wary but he grew to trust her.
sentences.chinese: 胡德一开始将信将疑，但后来信任她了。

definition: to believe firmly without any doubt (idiom)/absolute certainty about sth
not to understand the situation/unaware of the ins and outs
decline to comment/not express an opinion/be noncommittal/hedge
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
see 煞有介事[sha4 you3 jie4 shi4]
deeply worried and sick at heart (idiom)
absolutely true (idiom)/manifold/true from many points of view
to make a show of being very much in earnest (idiom)/to act as if one is taking things very seriously
